citation: Proclamation under the Nature Conservation Act 2002 (Tas)
text:
Proclamation under the Nature Conservation Act 2002

I, the Governor in and over the State of Tasmania and its Dependencies in the Commonwealth of Australia, acting with the advice of the Executive Council, by this my proclamation made under section 11(2) of the Nature Conservation Act 2002 declare â€“

        (a) the areas of Crown land specified in Schedule 1 to this proclamation to be reserved land in the class of conservation area and give the name Peter Murrell Conservation Area to that reserved land; and
        (b) that this proclamation takes effect on the day on which its making is notified in the Gazette.
28 July 2008

PETER G. UNDERWOOD

Governor

By His Excellency's Command,

D. E. LLEWELLYN

Minister for Primary Industries and Water

SCHEDULE 1 - Peter Murrell Conservation Area

All those areas of land comprising approximately 9.166 hectares (shown as Lot 1) and approximately 1.771 hectares (shown as Lot 2) and bounded by heavy black lines on Plan 7376 in the Central Plan Register, a reduced copy of which is set out, by way of illustration only, in Schedule 2 to this proclamation.

SCHEDULE 2 - Plan

Displayed and numbered in accordance with the Rules Publication Act 1953.

Notified in the Gazette on 6 August 2008

This proclamation is administered in the Department of Primary Industries and Water.
